text:
Electric vehicles have many advantages:
- They are environmentally friendly and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
- They are energy-efficient and cost-effective to operate.
- They are quiet and provide a smooth driving experience.
- They require less maintenance than traditional vehicles.
- They are eligible for government incentives and rebates.
summary: Electric vehicles have advantages and disadvantages. They are environmentally friendly, energy-efficient, and cost-effective to operate. However, they have limited driving range, are more expensive to purchase, and may not have readily available charging infrastructure.

text:
Electric vehicles have some disadvantages:
- They have limited driving range and require frequent recharging.
- They are more expensive to purchase than traditional vehicles.
- Charging infrastructure is limited and may not be readily available.
summary: Electric vehicles have advantages and disadvantages. They are environmentally friendly, energy-efficient, and cost-effective to operate. However, they have limited driving range, are more expensive to purchase, and may not have readily available charging infrastructure.

text: The COVID-19 pandemic has had a significant impact on the global economy. Lockdowns and travel restrictions have disrupted supply chains and reduced consumer demand, leading to widespread job losses and business closures. Governments around the world have implemented stimulus measures to support businesses and individuals affected by the crisis.
summary: COVID-19 had a major impact on the global financial system including in job losses.

text: The COVID-19 pandemic has led to widespread job losses and business closures. Governments around the world have implemented stimulus measures to support businesses and individuals affected by the crisis. The pandemic has also accelerated digital transformation and remote work trends.
summary: COVID-19 had a major impact on the global financial system including in job losses.
